alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Dickens; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 3:12AM CDT until July 16 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Dickens County in northwestern Texas... King County in northwestern Texas... Cottle County in northwestern Texas... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 311 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles west of Chalk, or 9 miles south of Paducah, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. The West Texas Mesonet site 10 miles west of Guthrie reported a wind gust to 59 mph at 302 AM. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Paducah, Guthrie, Grow, Dumont, Finney, Delwin, Chalk, Swearingen and Hackberry. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
